    -Self:SELF.make :INTEGER

Public

    -Self:SELF.open :INTEGER
        Open a joystick for use. The index passed as an argument refers to the N'th joystick on the system. This index is the value which will identify this joystick in future joystick events. This function returns a joystick identifier, or NULL if an error occurred.

Public

    -Self:SELF.index:INTEGER
        Get the device index of the opened joystick.

Public

    -Self:SELF.num_axes:INTEGER
        Get the number of general axis controls on the opened joystick

Public

    -Self:SELF.num_balls:INTEGER
        Get the number of trackballs on a joystick. Joystick trackballs have only relative motion events associated with them and their state cannot be polled.

Public

    -Self:SELF.num_hats:INTEGER
        Get the number of POV hats on a joystick

Public

    -Self:SELF.num_buttons:INTEGER
        Get the number of buttons on the opened joystick

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_axis :INTEGER :INTEGER
        Get the current state of an axis control on the opened joystick The axis indices start at index 0. The return state is a value ranging from to .

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_hat :INTEGER :UINTEGER_8
        Get the current state of a POV hat on a joystick. The hat indices start at index .

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_ball (:INTEGER,:INTEGER,:INTEGER) :INTEGER
        Get the ball axis change since the last poll The ball indices start at index . This returns , or if you passed it invalid parameters.

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_button :INTEGER :UINTEGER_8
        Get the current state of a button on the opened joystick. The button indices start at index .

Public

    -Self:SELF.close
        Close a joystick previously opened with

Public

    -Self:SELF.joystick_name :INTEGER :STRING
        Get the implementation dependent name of a joystick. This can be called before any joysticks are opened. If no name can be found, this function returns NULL.

Public

    -Self:SELF.opened :INTEGER :INTEGER
        Returns 1 if the joystick has been opened, or 0 if it has not.

Public

    -Self:SELF.num_joysticks:INTEGER
        Count the number of joysticks attached to the system

Public

    -Self:SELF.update
        Update the current state of the open joysticks. This is called automatically by the event loop if any joystick events are enabled.

Public

    -Self:SELF.event_state :INTEGER :INTEGER
        Enable/disable joystick event polling. If joystick events are disabled, you must call yourself and check the state of the joystick when you want joystick information. The state can be one of , or .
